Class WaveCollection

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractMap<Float,Wave>
java.util.TreeMap<Float,Wave>
sk.stuba.fiit.WaveCollection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Map<Float,Wave>, NavigableMap<Float,Wave>, SequencedMap<Float,Wave>, SortedMap<Float,Wave>
public class WaveCollection extends TreeMap<Float,Wave>
A specialized TreeMap that manages a collection of Wave objects, using weighted rarity-based keys to facilitate probabilistic selection.

Each Wave is assigned a floating-point key based on its rarity. These keys are recalculated upon every addition to ensure fair distribution for selection using the getWave(float) method.

See Also:

      public void addWave(Wave wave)
      Adds a new Wave to the collection and recalculates selection keys based on rarity.

    • getWave

      public Wave getWave(float selector)
      Returns a Wave based on the provided selector value. Waves are selected based on rarity-weighted intervals.
      Parameters:
      selector - a float value typically between 0 and 1 used to select a wave
      Returns:
      the selected wave, or null if no match is found
